activities: Computer Basics- What is a Computer
desc:
On day - 1 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 1 given in the module descriptor

Unit I: Fundamentals to Computational Thinking and Building blocks
1.1 Computational thinking techniques (decomposition, pattern matching, abstraction, and algorithmic thinking)
name: Computer Algorithms and Programs

desc:
On day - 2 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 1 given in the module descriptor

Unit I: Fundamentals to Computational Thinking and Building blocks
1.1 Computational thinking techniques (decomposition, pattern matching, abstraction, and algorithmic thinking)
1.2 Algorithm: Definition, characteristics, and examples
1.3 Flowcharts: Definition, symbols, and problem solving
1.4 Algorithm vs flowchart vs pseudocode
name: Fundamentals to Computational Thinking and Building blocks

desc:
On day - 3 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 1 given in the module descriptor

Unit I: Fundamentals to Computational Thinking and Building blocks
1.3 Flowcharts: Definition, symbols, and problem solving
1.5 Problem statement definition, input and output determination, algorithm/flowchart development, and trace table composition.
1.6 Building blocks for problem-solving (branching, looping, subroutine, functions)
name: Flowcharts - 1

desc:
On day - 4 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 1 given in the module descriptor

Unit I: Fundamentals to Computational Thinking and Building blocks
1.3 Flowcharts: Definition, symbols, and problem solving
1.5 Problem statement definition, input and output determination, algorithm/flowchart development, and trace table composition.
1.6 Building blocks for problem-solving (branching, looping, subroutine, functions)
name: Flowcharts - 2

desc:
On day - 5 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 1 given in the module descriptor

Unit I: Fundamentals to Computational Thinking and Building blocks
1.3 Flowcharts: Definition, symbols, and problem solving
1.5 Problem statement definition, input and output determination, algorithm/flowchart development, and trace table composition.
1.6 Building blocks for problem-solving (branching, looping, subroutine, functions)
name: Flowcharts - 3

desc:
On day - 6 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 2 given in the module descriptor

Unit II: Introduction to Python
2.1 Different types of knowledge (declarative and imperative knowledge)
2.2 Definitions of computer architecture, machine language, assembly and high level language, assembler, compiler interpreter, editor, operating system
2.3 Identifiers, keywords, data types, operators, types of operators, variables, expressions, statements
name: Introduction to Python Programming-1

desc:
On day - 7 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 2 given in the module descriptor

Unit II: Introduction to Python
2.5 Control statements: branching (if-elif-else statement), looping (while, do-while, for statement)
name: Introduction to Python Programming-2

desc:
On day - 8 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 2 and unit - 6 given in the module descriptor

Unit II: Introduction to Python
2.4 Data input and output: print(), input(), library functions
Unit VI: String Operations
6.1 Concepts of string
6.2 String related library function
6.3 String handling and manipulation
name: Core Elements-1

desc:
On day - 9 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 2 given in the module descriptor

Unit II: Introduction to Python
2.6 Guess-check algorithm, approximate solutions, bisection search
name: Core Elements-2

desc:
On day - 10 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 2 given in the module descriptor

Unit II: Introduction to Python
2.6 Guess-check algorithm, approximate solutions, bisection search
name: Simple Algorithms

desc:
On day - 11 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 3 given in the module descriptor

Unit III: Functions
3.1 Fundamental concepts of function: function scope, calling function, passing data to and from a function, and default values
3.2 Predefined, user-defined function
name: Functions-1

desc:
On day - 12 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 3 given in the module descriptor

Unit III: Functions
3.1 Fundamental concepts of function: function scope, calling function, passing data to and from a function, and default values
3.2 Predefined, user-defined function
name: Functions-2

desc:
On day - 13 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 3 given in the module descriptor

Unit III: Functions
3.3 Iteration vs recursion
name: Recursions

desc:
On day - 14 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 4 given in the module descriptor

Unit IV: Tuples, Lists and Dictionaries
4.1 Concepts of sets, tuples, tuple assignment, list, and dictionaries
4.2 List operations, list slices and deletion, mutation, aliasing, cloning, nested lists
4.3 Sets, tuples, list and dictionaries examples
name: Tuples and Lists

desc:
On day - 15 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 4 given in the module descriptor

Unit IV: Tuples, Lists and Dictionaries
4.1 Concepts of sets, tuples, tuple assignment, list, and dictionaries
4.3 Sets, tuples, list and dictionaries examples
name: Dictionaries

desc:

Unit V: Testing, Debugging and Assertions
5.1 Programming challenges, bugs, debugging

desc:
On day - 17 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 5 given in the module descriptor

Unit V: Testing, Debugging and Assertions
5.1 Programming challenges, bugs, debugging
name: Testing and Debugging-2

activities: Computer Choosing a Word and Playing a Hand
desc:
On day - 18 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 5 given in the module descriptor

Unit V: Testing, Debugging and Assertions
5.2 Assertions, exceptions in python, exception classes, built-in exceptions, try and catch statement, multiple catch statements, throw and throws statement
5.3 Exceptions: Creating and handling exceptions
name: Assertions and Exception handling

desc:
On day - 19 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 7 given in the module descriptor

Unit VII: Introduction to python packages
7.1 Pandas: Definition, example, usage
7.2 Matplotlib: Definition, example, usage
7.3 NumPy: Definition, example, usage
name: Python packages

activities: File Objects - Reading and Writing to Files
desc:
On day - 20 you will learn the following topics from the unit - 8 given in the module descriptor

Unit VIII: Files
8.1 The file object, opening and closing a file (writing to and reading from a file)
8.2 Processing files (library functions related to file- open(), read(), readlines(), write(), seek(), etc)
name: File Input Output
